contentrichtext.text: {{BLP sources|date=September 2010}} '''Braulio Castillo, Jr.''' (born c. 1958) is a [[Puerto Rico|Puerto Rican]] actor, [[radio host]], and [[Master of Ceremonies|MC]]. He is the son of [[Braulio Castillo]], a legendary actor across Latin America, and the brother of the lesser known Jorge Castillo, also a television and theater actor. ==Biography== For a short time during the 1970s, he was first known in [[Puerto Rico]] doing newsbreaks for WKBM-TV Channel 11 in [[Caguas, Puerto Rico|Caguas]], now [[Univision]] [[Owned and operated station|O&O]] [[WLII]].<ref>[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gp9ufJqwfD8 El once en las noticias] on [[YouTube]]</ref> Castillo reached national fame in Puerto Rico when he participated in the 1984 [[Telenovela|Spanish soap opera]] ''[[Coralito]]'' at [[San Juan, Puerto Rico|San Juan]]-based [[WKAQ-TV]] Channel 2. There, he shared star billing with [[Mexican people|Mexican]] actor [[Salvador Pineda]] and with [[Sully Diaz]]. Castillo reached teen idol status across Puerto Rico after that soap opera. In 1985, he was the star of the ''[[Tanairi]]'' soap opera, alongside [[Von Marie Mendez|Von Marie]]. Castillo subsequently worked on soap operas in different countries, such as Mexico, [[Peru]] and [[Venezuela]]. As the 1990s came about he starred in the television [[sitcom]] broadcast by WKAQ: ''Tres Hombres y...'', inspired by the movie ''[[Three Men and a Baby]]'', alongside [[Raymond Arrieta]] and [[Alba Nydia Díaz]]. Castillo also was the leading man of the [[telenovela]] ''Karina Montaner'', opposite [[Giselle Blondet]], broadcast by [[WAPA-TV]] Channel 4, also in San Juan. For several years, Braulio starred in various [[soap operas]] in [[Colombia]]. In 2003, Castillo resurfaced, in the film ''[[Los Diaz de Doris]]'', alongside co-star [[Cordelia Gonzalez]], actress and senator [[Velda González]], actor [[Kidany Lugo]] and former [[Major League Baseball]] player [[Tommy Cruz|Cirilo Cruz]]. In 2006, he performed the leading role in the musical: ''[[A Chorus Line]]'', at the [[Caguas Performing Arts Center]], alongside [[Marian Pabón]] and [[Daniela Droz]], among others. Castillo was acknowledged not only for his acting, but for his phenomenal attributes as a stage dancer. Presently (2007), he hosts a daily radio morning [[talk show]] alongside ''Mirayda Chavez'', the daughter of [[Awilda Carbia]] and performs in numerous theatre productions in San Juan. Also, Castillo performed the leading role of the new [[Jacobo Morales]]'s action film titled ''[[Angel (2007 Puerto Rican film)|Ángel]]''. He's currently performing on stage in the Puerto Rican premiere of [[God of Carnage]] at the [[Teatro Tapia|Tapia Theatre]] in San Juan. ==Acting career== {| class="wikitable" |- bgcolor="#CCCCCC" align="center" !
